newsitem.title: USA: NBC tops Nielsen TV ratings for April 21-27.
newsitem.headline: NBC tops Nielsen TV ratings for April 21-27.

text.p: NBC led prime time television viewer ratings for the week April 21 to April 27, with six of its shows, led by hospital drama series E.R., crowding the top 10 spots, Nielsen Media Research said Tuesday.
NBC, a unit of General Electric Co, posted a 10.9 rating points with a 19 percent share, said Nielsen, a unit of Cognizant Corp.
Westinghouse Corp unit CBS, with three shows in the top 10 most-watched prime time shows, had 10.0 points and a 19 percent share.
ABC, a unit of Walt Disney Co, logged 8.1 points and 14 percent share.
Fox, a News Corp unit, had 7.1 points and a 12 percent share.
Viacom Inc's UPN was next with a 3.0 rating and 5 percent share while Time Warner Inc's Warner Bros. was last with 2.5 points and 4.0 percent share.
The ratings points represent a percentage of homes with televisions and the share represents sets turned in at a particular time.

NBC's other top rated shows during the week, in order, "Seinfeld" (No. 2), "Fired Up," which is a new comedy series (No. 3), "Friends" (No. 5), "Suddenly Susan" (No. 6) and the "32nd Country Music Awards" (No. 9).
CBS came in with three shows in the top 10: "Touched by an Angel" (No. 4), "CBS Sunday Movie" (No. 6) and "Walker, Texas Ranger" (No. 10.).
The lone ABC show in the top 10 shows for the week was newsmagazine 20/20, which landed on the 8th spot.
